result.execSummary:
The defendant Breion D Whiteside was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Movable Property fr. Person/Corpse, a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: May transfer probation to Milwaukee County.

miscConds.notes: Restitution of $1,012.08 for the District Attorney's office for travel expenses for the victim to attend the trial and $1,473.83 for restitution for Brookfield Place Gas Station. Restitution to be paid as a condition of probation before costs and fees.
Costs to be paid as a condition of probation.

Submit to an AODA assessment, follow through with any treatment, counseling.  No use or possession of alcohol or illegal drugs/drug paraphernalia. Comply with random urine screens.  Maintain absolute sobriety. No use or possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription. Valid prescriptions only with prior agent approval and to be taken only in the manner they are ordered.

No Contact with Brookfield Place Gas Station or clerk listed in the criminal complaint or with any co-defendants listed in the criminal complaint. Provide DNA Specimen unless previously obtained. Surcharge is imposed. Maintain employment and/or school combination. Follow through with any treatment or counseling recommended by agent.
No use or possession of any weapons.
  If Probation/Extended Supervision is revoked and/or a prison term ordered, outstanding financial obligations shall be collected pursuant to statutory provisions, including deductions from inmate prison monies.  If discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collections may include income assignment.

timeConds.notes:
Commencing forthwith. Non-working hours (Huber), release for standard conditions. May transfer to Milwaukee County but NO Electronic Monitoring allowed. 
LAST 60 days, non-working hours (Huber) release for standard conditions are STAYED for use at agent's discretion.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Breion D Whiteside

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Breion D Whiteside in court with Attorney Paul Garland Bonneson.  Andrea M Will appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case called for sentencing hearing.  Parties do not have any corrections to PSI today and state has complied with victims rights consultation.  State gives sentencing recommendations.  Attorney Bonneson makes statements regarding sentencing.  Ella T. makes statements.  Frances W. makes statements.  Defendant makes statements.  Court sentences the Defendant to the following:

COUNT #1:  WITHHELD SENTENCE

TERM OF PROBATION:  4 YEARS    **Transfer allowed to Milwaukee County** 

CONDITIONS OF PROBATON:  
____Absolute Sobriety;  Random U.A.'s ; 
____No Use or Possession of alcohol or illegal drugs 
____No Use or Possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription;
____Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are 
prescribed/sign releases.
____Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent;
____Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling 
____No contact with: Brookfield Place Gas station or clerk listed in criminal complaint or with Co-Defendant listed in criminal complaint
____No use or possession of any weapons
____DNA sample to be provided if not yet previously done 

RESTITUTION:  $1,012.08 to District Attorney's Office for travel expenses for victim to come for trial (to be paid as a condition of probation - restitution to be paid before costs or fines)
                          $1,473.83 to Brookfield Place Gas Station (to be paid as a condition of probation - restitution to be paid before costs or fines)

COSTS:  $278.00 & $250.00 DNA surcharge (to be paid as a condition of probation)

CONDITION TIME:  12 Months, Non-working hours with standard release conditions to commence forthwith-Transfer allowed to Milwaukee County (No EM allowed) & 60 Days Non-working hours with standard release conditions- STAYED - to be used at agent's discretion

Felony Warnings, Voting Rights and Firearms Warnings provided to defendant
Defense PSI filed by Atty Bonneson.
Sentencing hearing on February 20, 2017 at 03:30 pm.

ADDRESS INFO for Breion D Whiteside
Current: 3030 N 124th St #109, Wauwatosa, WI 53222   (Effective: 08-21-2015)
Prior: 3030 N 124th St #112, Wauwatosa, WI 53222

Defendant Breion D Whiteside in court with Attorney Paul Garland Bonneson.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern Shannon Tenney appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case called for plea hearing.  Defendant enters a guilty plea to Count #1.  Court performs plea colloquy and finds Defendant guilty of Count #1.  State requests a presentence investigation.  Court orders presentemce investigation and sets sentencing date.   Bail remains as fixed.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for February 20, 2017 at 03:30 pm.
